si.ijs.kt.clus.algo.kNN.methods

Class NNStack

  • java.lang.Object
    • si.ijs.kt.clus.algo.kNN.methods.NNStack

  • public class NNStack
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements simple insertion algorithm for maintaining k nearest neighbors.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NNStack(int k)
      Construct new stack for storing k nearest neighbors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToStack(DataTuple tuple, double dist)
      Add new DataTuple tuple with distance dist to stack (if and only if the distance is small enough regarding to tuples already on stack.
      boolean enoughNeighbours() 
      double getWorstNearestDistance()
      Returns distance of farthest nearest neighbor.
      NN[] returnPureStack() 
      java.util.LinkedList<DataTuple> returnStack()
      Returns k nearest neighbors among those added to stack.

    • Method Detail

      • addToStack

        public void addToStack(DataTuple tuple,
                       double dist)
        Add new DataTuple tuple with distance dist to stack (if and only if the distance is small enough regarding to tuples already on stack.
        Parameters:
        tuple - to be added
        dist - distance of tuple to tuple to be classified

      • getWorstNearestDistance

        public double getWorstNearestDistance()
        Returns distance of farthest nearest neighbor.

      • enoughNeighbours

        public boolean enoughNeighbours()
        Returns:
        true if at least k candidates were added so far and false if we are desperate for more nearest neighbors

      • returnStack

        public java.util.LinkedList<DataTuple> returnStack()
        Returns k nearest neighbors among those added to stack.
